required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Study of Solifenacin Succinate and Tamsulosin Hydrochloride Oral Controlled Absorption System (OCAS) in Males With Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Long Term, Multi-center Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Fixed Dose Combinations of Solifenacin Succinate (6 mg and 9 mg) With Tamsulosin Hydrochloride OCAS 0.4 mg, in Male Subjects With Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms (LUTS) Associated With Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) With a Substantial Storage Component

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical study to examine the safety, tolerability and efficacy of long-term combination therapy of tamsulosin and solifenacin in the treatment of males with lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) associated with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) with a substantial storage component.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open-label extension study following the double blind 905-CL-055 study

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of double-blind study drug (if on FDC in 905-CL-055) or first open-label dose up to 30 days after last dose of open-label study drug (in 905-CL-057) (up to 56 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Safety is monitored by collecting AEs, which include abnormal lab parameters, vital signs or ECG data if the abnormality induced clinical signs or symptoms, needed active intervention, interruption or discontinuation of study drug or was clinically significant. A serious AE (SAE) was an AE resulting in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity or congenital anomaly/birth defect, was life-threatening, required or prolonged hospitalization or was considered medically important. AEs were assessed by the Investigator for intensity (mild-no disruption of normal daily activities, moderate-affected normal daily activities or severe-inability to perform daily activities) and for causal relationship to study drug. A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an AE that occurred after the intake of first dose of double-blind study drug (if on FDC in 905-CL-055) or after first open-label dose until 30 days after the last dose of open-label study drug (in 905-CL-057).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Post Void Residual (PVR) Volume
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
primary_outcome.description: PVR volume is the volume of urine retained after voiding. PVR volume was assessed by ultrasonography or bladder scan.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Maximum Flow Rate (Qmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
primary_outcome.description: Qmax during a micturition (urination) was recorded using uroflowmetry.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Average Flow Rate (Qmean)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
primary_outcome.description: Qmean during a micturition (urination) was recorded using uroflowmetry.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Total International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
primary_outcome.description: The International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms, based on answers to 7 questions concerning urinary symptoms: Incomplete emptying of the bladder Intermittency Weak stream Hesitancy Frequency Urgency Nocturia Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the symptom. Total score can range from 0 to 35 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Total Urgency Frequency Score (TUFS) (Previously Known as Total Urgency Score [TUS])
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Micturitions Per 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only.The mean number of micturitions per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Voided Volume Per Micturition
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only. The mean volume voided per micturition was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Maximum Volume Voided Per Micturition
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only. The maximum volume voided per micturition was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Urgency Episodes (PPIUS Grade 3 or 4) Per 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: An urgency episode is defined as an episode of strong desire to void accompanied by fear of leakage or pain. The mean number of urgency episodes with PPIUS grade 3 (Severe urgency) or 4 (Urgency incontinence) per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Urgency Incontinence Episodes Per 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: An urgency incontinence episode is defined as an episode with any involuntary leakage of urine accompanied by or immediately preceded by urgency. The mean number of urgency incontinence episodes with PPIUS grade 3 (Severe incontinence) or 4 (Urgency incontinence) per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Incontinence Episodes Per 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: An incontinence episode is defined as an episode with any involuntary loss of urine. The mean number of incontinence episodes per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Nocturia Episodes Per 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A nocturia episode is defined as waking up at night to void (i.e., any voiding associated with sleep disturbance between the time the participant goes to bed with the intention to sleep until the time the patient gets up in the morning with the intention to stay awake). The mean number of nocturia episodes per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Pads Used Per 24 Hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The mean number of pads per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in IPSS Voiding Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms based on answers to 7 questions. Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the particular symptom. The voiding score is the sum of the responses to 4 voiding questions (incomplete emptying of the bladder, intermittency, weak stream, hesitancy) and ranges from 0 to 20 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in IPSS Storage Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms based on answers to 7 questions concerning urinary symptoms. Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the particular symptom. The storage symptom score is the sum of the responses to 3 storage questions (frequency,urgency and nocturia) and ranges from 0 to 15 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in IPSS Quality of Life (QoL) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The QoL assessment was a single question asking the participant how he would feel about tolerating his current level of symptoms for the rest of his life. The answers ranged from 0 to 6 (delighted to terrible).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Individual IPSS Scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms, based on answers to 7 questions concerning urinary symptoms: Incomplete emptying of the bladder Intermittency Weak stream Hesitancy Frequency Urgency Nocturia Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the symptom.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Symptom Bother Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The Symptom Bother portion consists of an 8-item scale scored from 1 to 6.The total symptom bother score was calculated from the 8 answers and then transformed to range from 0 to 100, with 100 indicating worst severity. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Subscale: Coping Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The HRQoL portion consists of an 25-item HRQoL subscale containing the following domains scored from 1 to 6: coping concern sleep social interaction Coping score can range from 8 to 48 (none of the time to all of the time) and transformed to a scale from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better quality of life. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Subscale: Concern Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The HRQoL portion consists of an 25-item HRQoL subscale containing the following domains scored from 1 to 6: coping concern sleep social interaction Concern score can range from 8 to 48 (none of the time to all of the time) and transformed to a scale from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better quality of life. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Subscale: Sleep Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The HRQoL portion consists of an 25-item HRQoL subscale containing the following domains scored from 1 to 6: coping concern sleep social interaction Sleep score can range from 8 to 48 (none of the time to all of the time) and transformed to a scale from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better quality of life. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Subscale: Social Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The HRQoL portion consists of an 25-item HRQoL subscale containing the following domains scored from 1 to 6: coping concern sleep social interaction Social score can range from 8 to 48 (none of the time to all of the time) and transformed to a scale from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better quality of life. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Subscale: Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The HRQoL portion consists of an 25-item HRQoL subscale containing the following domains scored from 1 to 6: coping concern sleep social interaction Total score is calculated by adding the 4 HRQoL subscale scores and transforming to a scale from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better quality of life. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of OAB-q Responders Based on Health-related Quality of Life: Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: A OAB-q responder was defined as a participant with an improvement from baseline in HRQoL subscale total score ≥ 10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in EQ-5D Mobility Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The European quality of life-5 dimensions (EQ-5D) is an international standardized non-disease specific instrument for describing and valuing health status. The EQ5D has 5 domains: mobility self-care usual activity pain/discomfort anxiety/depression Each domain has 3 response levels (1= no problem, 2= some problems, 3 = confined to bed).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in EQ-5D Self-care Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The European quality of life-5 dimensions (EQ-5D) is an international standardized non-disease specific instrument for describing and valuing health status. The EQ5D has 5 domains: mobility self-care usual activity pain/discomfort anxiety/depression Each domain has 3 response levels (1= no problem, 2= some problems, 3 = unable to wash/dress).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in EQ-5D Usual Activities Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The European quality of life-5 dimensions (EQ-5D) is an international standardized non-disease specific instrument for describing and valuing health status. The EQ5D has 5 domains: mobility self-care usual activity pain/discomfort anxiety/depression Each domain has 3 response levels (1= no problem, 2= some problems, 3 = unable to perform usual activities).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in EQ-5D Pain/Discomfort Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The European quality of life-5 dimensions (EQ-5D) is an international standardized non-disease specific instrument for describing and valuing health status. The EQ5D has 5 domains: mobility self-care usual activity pain/discomfort anxiety/depression Each domain has 3 response levels (1= no pain, 2= moderate pain, 3 = extreme pain).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in EQ-5D Anxiety/Depression Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The European quality of life-5 dimensions (EQ-5D) is an international standardized non-disease specific instrument for describing and valuing health status. The EQ5D has 5 domains: mobility self-care usual activity pain/discomfort anxiety/depression Each domain has 3 response levels (1= not anxious, 2= moderately anxious, 3 = extremely anxious).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in EQ-5D Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) is part of the EQ-5D questionnaire. The VAS is self-rated by the participant ranging from 0 to 100 (worst imaginable health state to best imaginable health state).

arm_group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of open-label fixed dose combination (FDC) treatment

intervention.intervention_name: tamsulosin hydrochloride/solifenacin succinate fixed dose combination (0.4 mg/6 mg)
tamsulosin hydrochloride/solifenacin succinate fixed dose combination (0.4 mg/9 mg)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Completion of 12 weeks double-blind treatment in Study 905-CL-055
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any significant PVR volume (>150 mL)

link.description: Link to results on Astellas Clinical Study Results website

patient_data.ipd_description: Details of the IPD sharing plan for this study can be found at www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were eligible for Study 905-CL-057 if they completed 12 weeks of double-blind treatment in Study 905-CL-055, complied with inclusion criteria and did not meet any exclusion criteria. Participants treated with the FDC 0.4 mg/6 mg or 0.4 mg/9 mg for maximally 40 weeks.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All eligible participants started with 4 weeks of open-label FDC 0.4 mg/6 mg and were given the opportunity to adjust their dose at 3 monthly intervals thereafter if desired.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of open-label FDC treatment

participants_list.participants: Took ≥ 1 dose of FDC open-label study drug

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of open-label FDC treatment

measure.title: Age, Customized
Sex/Gender, Customized
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Total International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
measure.description: FAS population excluding 5 patients with invalid questionnaires. The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of "bother" from urinary symptoms, based on answers to 7questions concerning urinary symptoms: Incomplete emptying of the bladder Intermittency Weak stream Hesitancy Frequency Urgency Nocturia Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the symptom. Total score can range from 0 to 35 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).

measure.title: Total International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) voiding score
measure.description: FAS population excluding 5 patients with invalid questionnaires. The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of "bother" from urinary symptoms based on answers to 7 questions. Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the particular symptom. The voiding score is the sum of the responses to 4 voiding questions (incomplete emptying of the bladder, intermittency, weak stream, hesitancy) and ranges from 0 to 20 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).

measure.title: Total International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) storage score
measure.description: FAS population excluding 5 patients with invalid questionnaires.The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of "bother" from urinary symptoms based on answers to 7 questions. Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the particular symptom. The storage symptom score is the sum of the responses to 3 storage questions (frequency, urgency and nocturia) and ranges from 0 to 15 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).

measure.title: IPSS Quality of Life Score(Qol) score
measure.description: FAS population excluding 5 patients with invalid questionnaires. The QoL assessment was a single question asking the participant how he would feel about tolerating his current level of symptoms for the rest of his life. The answers ranged from 0 to 6 (delighted to terrible).

measure.title: Total Urgency Frequency Score (TUFS) (previous known as Total Urgency Score (TUS)
measure.description: FAS population.The Participant Perception of the Intensity of Urgency Scale (PPIUS) is a validated scale completed as part of the micturition diary. For each micturition and/or incontinence episode, the participant rated the degree of associated urgency according to the following 5-point categorical scale: 0.No urgency; 1.Mild urgency; 2.Moderate urgency; 3.Severe urgency; 4.Urgency incontinence. TUFS/TUS was the sum of the PPIUS gradings from the 3-day diary divided by the number of days on which urgency grading was recorded.

measure.title: Micturitions/24 hour
measure.description: FAS population. A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only. The mean number of micturitions per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

measure.title: Volume voided/micturition
measure.description: FAS population. A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only. The mean volume voided per micturition was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

measure.title: Incontinence episodes/24 hour
measure.description: FAS population. An incontinence episode is defined as an episode with any involuntary loss of urine. The mean number of incontinence episodes per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

measure.title: Urgency incontinence episodes /24 hour
measure.description: FAS population. An urgency incontinence episode is defined as an episode with any involuntary leakage of urine accompanied by or immediately preceded by urgency. The mean number of urgency incontinence episodes with PPIUS grade 3 (Severe urgency) or 4 (Urgency incontinence) per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

measure.title: Nocturia episodes/ 24 hour
measure.description: FAS population. A nocturia episode is defined as waking up at night to void (i.e., any voiding associated with sleep disturbance between the time the participant goes to bed with the intention to sleep until the time the patient gets up in the morning with the intention to stay awake). The mean number of nocturia episodes per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: Safety is monitored by collecting AEs, which include abnormal lab parameters, vital signs or ECG data if the abnormality induced clinical signs or symptoms, needed active intervention, interruption or discontinuation of study drug or was clinically significant. A serious AE (SAE) was an AE resulting in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity or congenital anomaly/birth defect, was life-threatening, required or prolonged hospitalization or was considered medically important. AEs were assessed by the Investigator for intensity (mild-no disruption of normal daily activities, moderate-affected normal daily activities or severe-inability to perform daily activities) and for causal relationship to study drug. A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an AE that occurred after the intake of first dose of double-blind study drug (if on FDC in 905-CL-055) or after first open-label dose until 30 days after the last dose of open-label study drug (in 905-CL-057).
outcome.time_frame: From first dose of double-blind study drug (if on FDC in 905-CL-055) or first open-label dose up to 30 days after last dose of open-label study drug (in 905-CL-057) (up to 56 weeks)
outcome.population: Safety analysis set-participants who received at least 1 dose of the FDC tamsulosin/solifenacin 0.4 mg/6 mg or 0.4 mg/9 mg during the open-label treatment period and had any data reported after the first dose of the FDC during the open-label treatment period

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of open-label FDC treatment

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: Safety is monitored by collecting AEs, which include abnormal lab parameters, vital signs or ECG data if the abnormality induced clinical signs or symptoms, needed active intervention, interruption or discontinuation of study drug or was clinically significant. A serious AE (SAE) was an AE resulting in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity or congenital anomaly/birth defect, was life-threatening, required or prolonged hospitalization or was considered medically important. AEs were assessed by the Investigator for intensity (mild-no disruption of normal daily activities, moderate-affected normal daily activities or severe-inability to perform daily activities) and for causal relationship to study drug. A treatment-emergent adverse event (TEAE) was defined as an AE that occurred after the intake of first dose of double-blind study drug (if on FDC in 905-CL-055) or after first open-label dose until 30 days after the last dose of open-label study drug (in 905-CL-057).
measure.population: Safety analysis set-participants who received at least 1 dose of the FDC tamsulosin/solifenacin 0.4 mg/6 mg or 0.4 mg/9 mg during the open-label treatment period and had any data reported after the first dose of the FDC during the open-label treatment period

class.title: Any TEAE causing discontinuation of study drug.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Post Void Residual (PVR) Volume
outcome.description: PVR volume is the volume of urine retained after voiding. PVR volume was assessed by ultrasonography or bladder scan.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: SAF population with at least one baseline and one post-baseline PVR volume measured.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of open-label FDC treatment

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Post Void Residual (PVR) Volume
measure.description: PVR volume is the volume of urine retained after voiding. PVR volume was assessed by ultrasonography or bladder scan.
measure.population: SAF population with at least one baseline and one post-baseline PVR volume measured.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Maximum Flow Rate (Qmax)
outcome.description: Qmax during a micturition (urination) was recorded using uroflowmetry.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: SAF population with at least one baseine and one post-baseline micturition episode.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of open-label FDC treatment

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Maximum Flow Rate (Qmax)
measure.description: Qmax during a micturition (urination) was recorded using uroflowmetry.
measure.population: SAF population with at least one baseine and one post-baseline micturition episode.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Average Flow Rate (Qmean)
outcome.description: Qmean during a micturition (urination) was recorded using uroflowmetry.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: SAF population with at least one baseline and one post-baseline micturition episode.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of open-label FDC treatment

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Average Flow Rate (Qmean)
measure.description: Qmean during a micturition (urination) was recorded using uroflowmetry.
measure.population: SAF population with at least one baseline and one post-baseline micturition episode.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Total International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
outcome.description: The International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms, based on answers to 7 questions concerning urinary symptoms: Incomplete emptying of the bladder Intermittency Weak stream Hesitancy Frequency Urgency Nocturia Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the symptom. Total score can range from 0 to 35 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS)-participants who took at least 1 dose of the FDC during the open-label study, had a total IPSS or TUS at baseline and had at least one total IPSS or TUS after first dose of the FDC in Study 905-CL-057. Excluded 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Total International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS)
measure.description: The International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms, based on answers to 7 questions concerning urinary symptoms: Incomplete emptying of the bladder Intermittency Weak stream Hesitancy Frequency Urgency Nocturia Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the symptom. Total score can range from 0 to 35 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS)-participants who took at least 1 dose of the FDC during the open-label study, had a total IPSS or TUS at baseline and had at least one total IPSS or TUS after first dose of the FDC in Study 905-CL-057. Excluded 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Micturitions Per 24 Hours
outcome.description: A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only.The mean number of micturitions per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Micturitions Per 24 Hours
measure.description: A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only.The mean number of micturitions per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Voided Volume Per Micturition
outcome.description: A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only. The mean volume voided per micturition was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Voided Volume Per Micturition
measure.description: A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only. The mean volume voided per micturition was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Maximum Volume Voided Per Micturition
outcome.description: A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only. The maximum volume voided per micturition was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Maximum Volume Voided Per Micturition
measure.description: A micturition is any voluntary urination, excluding episodes of incontinence only. The maximum volume voided per micturition was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Urgency Episodes (PPIUS Grade 3 or 4) Per 24 Hours
outcome.description: An urgency episode is defined as an episode of strong desire to void accompanied by fear of leakage or pain. The mean number of urgency episodes with PPIUS grade 3 (Severe urgency) or 4 (Urgency incontinence) per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with at least 1 urgency episode at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Urgency Episodes (PPIUS Grade 3 or 4) Per 24 Hours
measure.description: An urgency episode is defined as an episode of strong desire to void accompanied by fear of leakage or pain. The mean number of urgency episodes with PPIUS grade 3 (Severe urgency) or 4 (Urgency incontinence) per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS population with at least 1 urgency episode at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Urgency Incontinence Episodes Per 24 Hours
outcome.description: An urgency incontinence episode is defined as an episode with any involuntary leakage of urine accompanied by or immediately preceded by urgency. The mean number of urgency incontinence episodes with PPIUS grade 3 (Severe incontinence) or 4 (Urgency incontinence) per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population and at least 1 urgency incontinence episode at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Urgency Incontinence Episodes Per 24 Hours
measure.description: An urgency incontinence episode is defined as an episode with any involuntary leakage of urine accompanied by or immediately preceded by urgency. The mean number of urgency incontinence episodes with PPIUS grade 3 (Severe incontinence) or 4 (Urgency incontinence) per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS population and at least 1 urgency incontinence episode at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Incontinence Episodes Per 24 Hours
outcome.description: An incontinence episode is defined as an episode with any involuntary loss of urine. The mean number of incontinence episodes per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population and at least 1 incontinence episode at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057).

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Incontinence Episodes Per 24 Hours
measure.description: An incontinence episode is defined as an episode with any involuntary loss of urine. The mean number of incontinence episodes per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS population and at least 1 incontinence episode at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Nocturia Episodes Per 24 Hours
outcome.description: A nocturia episode is defined as waking up at night to void (i.e., any voiding associated with sleep disturbance between the time the participant goes to bed with the intention to sleep until the time the patient gets up in the morning with the intention to stay awake). The mean number of nocturia episodes per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population and at least 1 nocturia episode at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Nocturia Episodes Per 24 Hours
measure.description: A nocturia episode is defined as waking up at night to void (i.e., any voiding associated with sleep disturbance between the time the participant goes to bed with the intention to sleep until the time the patient gets up in the morning with the intention to stay awake). The mean number of nocturia episodes per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS population and at least 1 nocturia episode at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Pads Used Per 24 Hours
outcome.description: The mean number of pads per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population and at least 1 use of a pad at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Mean Number of Pads Used Per 24 Hours
measure.description: The mean number of pads per 24 hours was calculated from data recorded by the participant in the micturition diary for the 3 days preceding each clinic visit.
measure.population: FAS population and at least 1 use of a pad at baseline. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Total Urgency Frequency Score (TUFS) (Previously Known as Total Urgency Score [TUS])
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Total Urgency Frequency Score (TUFS) (Previously Known as Total Urgency Score [TUS])
measure.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in IPSS Voiding Score
outcome.description: The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms based on answers to 7 questions. Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the particular symptom. The voiding score is the sum of the responses to 4 voiding questions (incomplete emptying of the bladder, intermittency, weak stream, hesitancy) and ranges from 0 to 20 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: A total of 5 subjects has been excluded from the FAS analysis due to invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in IPSS Voiding Score
measure.description: The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms based on answers to 7 questions. Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the particular symptom. The voiding score is the sum of the responses to 4 voiding questions (incomplete emptying of the bladder, intermittency, weak stream, hesitancy) and ranges from 0 to 20 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).
measure.population: A total of 5 subjects has been excluded from the FAS analysis due to invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in IPSS Storage Score
outcome.description: The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms based on answers to 7 questions concerning urinary symptoms. Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the particular symptom. The storage symptom score is the sum of the responses to 3 storage questions (frequency,urgency and nocturia) and ranges from 0 to 15 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: A total of 5 subjects has been excluded from the FAS analysis due to invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in IPSS Storage Score
measure.description: The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms based on answers to 7 questions concerning urinary symptoms. Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the particular symptom. The storage symptom score is the sum of the responses to 3 storage questions (frequency,urgency and nocturia) and ranges from 0 to 15 (mildly symptomatic to severely symptomatic).
measure.population: A total of 5 subjects has been excluded from the FAS analysis due to invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in IPSS Quality of Life (QoL) Score
outcome.description: The QoL assessment was a single question asking the participant how he would feel about tolerating his current level of symptoms for the rest of his life. The answers ranged from 0 to 6 (delighted to terrible).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in IPSS Quality of Life (QoL) Score
measure.description: The QoL assessment was a single question asking the participant how he would feel about tolerating his current level of symptoms for the rest of his life. The answers ranged from 0 to 6 (delighted to terrible).
measure.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Individual IPSS Scores
outcome.description: The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms, based on answers to 7 questions concerning urinary symptoms: Incomplete emptying of the bladder Intermittency Weak stream Hesitancy Frequency Urgency Nocturia Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the symptom.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: A total of 5 subjects has been excluded from the FAS analysis due to invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used.

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Individual IPSS Scores
measure.description: The IPSS is a validated global questionnaire to assess the degree of urinary symptoms, based on answers to 7 questions concerning urinary symptoms: Incomplete emptying of the bladder Intermittency Weak stream Hesitancy Frequency Urgency Nocturia Each question is assigned points from 0 to 5 indicating increasing severity of the symptom.
measure.population: A total of 5 subjects has been excluded from the FAS analysis due to invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Symptom Bother Score
outcome.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The Symptom Bother portion consists of an 8-item scale scored from 1 to 6.The total symptom bother score was calculated from the 8 answers and then transformed to range from 0 to 100, with 100 indicating worst severity. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Symptom Bother Score
measure.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The Symptom Bother portion consists of an 8-item scale scored from 1 to 6.The total symptom bother score was calculated from the 8 answers and then transformed to range from 0 to 100, with 100 indicating worst severity. A negative change from baseline indicates an improvement.
measure.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Subscale: Coping Score
outcome.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The HRQoL portion consists of an 25-item HRQoL subscale containing the following domains scored from 1 to 6: coping concern sleep social interaction Coping score can range from 8 to 48 (none of the time to all of the time) and transformed to a scale from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better quality of life. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Subscale: Total Score
outcome.description: The Overactive Bladder Questionnaire (OAB-q) is a self-reported questionnaire with items relating to Symptom Bother and health-related quality of life (HRQoL). The HRQoL portion consists of an 25-item HRQoL subscale containing the following domains scored from 1 to 6: coping concern sleep social interaction Total score is calculated by adding the 4 HRQoL subscale scores and transforming to a scale from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better quality of life. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

The HRQoL portion consists of an 25-item HRQoL subscale containing the following domains scored from 1 to 6: coping concern sleep social interaction Total score is calculated by adding the 4 HRQoL subscale scores and transforming to a scale from 0 to 100, with higher scores indicating better quality of life. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement.
measure.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

outcome.title: Number of OAB-q Responders Based on Health-related Quality of Life: Total Score
outcome.description: A OAB-q responder was defined as a participant with an improvement from baseline in HRQoL subscale total score ≥ 10.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in EQ-5D Mobility Score
outcome.description: The European quality of life-5 dimensions (EQ-5D) is an international standardized non-disease specific instrument for describing and valuing health status. The EQ5D has 5 domains: mobility self-care usual activity pain/discomfort anxiety/depression Each domain has 3 response levels (1= no problem, 2= some problems, 3 = confined to bed).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

class.title: No problem -> unable to perform usual activities
Some problem -> unable to perform usual activities
Unable to perform usual activities -> no problem
Unable to perform usual activities -> some problem
Unable to perform usual activities -> same status
Unable to perform usual activities -> no data
No data -> unable to perform usual activities

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in EQ-5D Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score
outcome.description: Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) is part of the EQ-5D questionnaire. The VAS is self-rated by the participant ranging from 0 to 100 (worst imaginable health state to best imaginable health state).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and up to 52 weeks of FDC treatment
outcome.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received the open-label FDC treatment and were included in the Full Analysis Set of 905-CL-057

measure.title: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in EQ-5D Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) Score
measure.description: Visual Analogue Scale (VAS) is part of the EQ-5D questionnaire. The VAS is self-rated by the participant ranging from 0 to 100 (worst imaginable health state to best imaginable health state).
measure.population: FAS population with data available at both baseline and end of treatment and the exclusion of 5 participants with invalid questionnaires. LOCF imputation was used

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose of double-blind study drug (if on FDC in 905-CL-055) or first open-label dose up to 30 days after last dose of open-label study drug (in 905-CL-057) (up to 56 weeks)

group.title: Total Group
group.description: Participants who received at least one dose of open-label FDC treatment

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Institute and/or Principle Investigator may publish trial data generated at their specific study site after Sponsor publication of the multi-center data. Sponsor must receive a site's manuscript at least 90 days prior to publication for review and comment. Sponsor may delay the publication to seek patent approval.
